content.p: SconeServer aims to be simple to build from source on most systems. There are no pre-built binary packages available at the current time.
content.h2: Installing from source on Linux or UNIX systems
content.p: First, download the latest source tarball from the download page.
Untar to a temporary directory, then cd into the created directory:
Run the configure script to autodetect your system settings and generate the Makefiles:
Where <prefix> is the desired install location, which defaults to "/usr/local".
At this point, you may also wish to build and run the tests with:
Install SconeServer by doing make install. You will need to su to become root if you're installing to a system directory:
Make sure the directory "<prefix>/lib" is listed in "/etc/ld.so.conf", if not, add it to the end, then run ldconfig (as root).
And that's it, SconeServer is installed and ready to run. You'll probably want to read the section on configuration first though.
